page.title: 12Chinley-a local impression/2
page.content: We welcome strangers and make them part of the community.With the pavements deteriorating it is just as well. Here are good neighbours.Many an ankle has been sprained of late,but help is quickly on the scene. Bush telegraph relays news of everyone and everything -your happiness and sadness is shared. Lines to the new houses are being installed by British Telecom from the village electronic exchange. Taking stock every few years gives a catalogue of many minor changes: - A local Minister, the Reverend William Simpson, has just celebrated his Diamond Jubilee as an ordained minister.He is one of the best known local characters. - Double glazing brings new and often unsuitable windows, though home improvements have slowed down since the economic recession.{(cont.p13)
